title: Drawing, "Botanical Studies, seen from the Rio Magdalena, Colombia", 1853
markings: Wm:  parts of the letters K F
inscribed:
Top left: written beside tree tops: "Beautiful soft masses of/lightish yellow green foliage/ of a velvety appear-/ ance -- Appears at/ times like a tree at others/ like a vine clustering among/ the darker masses of a tree."
Bottom left:  Palm tree tops, caption: "2 Branch or leaf of / a rich orange and brown/ color this effect is common/ Palm."
Central:  "Bamboos".
Top right:  tree top caption:  "small/tree with fern/ shaped leaves, fresh/ growth at the top/yellow green-Under/ darker and bluish/ very delicate."
Bottom right:  A design and "Stem of Bam-/ boo-joints whitish/ stem green, brown/ whitish etc. A branch is shown beneath.

[from Dee catalogue:  Beautiful soft masses of  / lightish yellow green foliage/ of velveyy appear-/ance--- Appears at/times like a tree at others/like a vine clustering among/the darker masses of a tree; at lower left: 2.  Branch or leaf of /a rich orange and brown/color.  This effect is common/Palm; at center: Bamboos; at upper right: small/tree with fern/shaped leaves, fresh/growth at the top/yellow green - Under/darker and bluish/ Very delicate; at lower right: Stem of Bam-/boo-joints whitish/stem green, brown/whitish etc.
description: Top left:  Tree tops; Bottom left:  Palm tree tops; Central: Bamboo; Top right:  Tree top; bottom right: a design and stem of a bamboo.  A branch is shown beneath.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Botanical Studies, seen from the Rio Magdalena, Colombia", 1853.
1853. Graphite on gray wove paper. Gift of Louis P. Church. 1917-4-403.
